name: Dead Hangs (Static Holds)
description: Simply hang from the bar with both hands for time. Variation: Try overhand, underhand, and mixed grips. Progression: Add time or try one-arm hangs. Goal: 3–5 sets, 30–60 seconds.

name: Towel Hangs / Pull-Ups
description: Loop a towel over the bar and grip both ends. Mimics gripping a gi sleeve or collar. Progression: Do pull-ups while holding towels. Goal: 3–4 sets, 5–10 reps or 20–30s hangs.

name: Finger Hangs
description: Use just your fingers (e.g., 3-finger or 2-finger grip) on the bar or a ledge. Builds tendon and finger strength for grip fighting. Note: Start cautiously; tendon injuries take a long time to heal.

name: L-Sit Hangs / Core Hangs
description: Hang and lift your legs into an L-position. Engages core and increases time under tension for your grip. Goal: 3 sets, 20–30 seconds.
